dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: Inside a closet. It is a large closet with double doors, a crisp line of l cutting down through the center of the darkness. As we begin to descend, voices echo in our head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this image of you, inside of  me, like a part of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move past a shelf filled with hatboxes and handbags. is a woman's closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planned this whole thing, didn't  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the fucking money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We glide over the tightly packed hangers, close enough to feel the different fabrics and descend past the dresses t the racks of high heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make our own choices, we pay our  own prices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All part of the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All part of the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We slide along the delicate taper of a stiletto heel and  reach the bottom of the closet, where we find a pair of b Dr. Martens boots that are tied together with a white rop

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move up the boots and we see it is a woman who is boun lying motionless on the floor of the closet, the rope coi tightly around her wrists. The crack at the bottom of the door lights her face.  She gagged and unconscious, a trickle of blood running down h forehead.  Her name is CORKY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a part of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaning against the back of the elevator is Corky, a very butch-looking woman with short hair and a black leather  jacket.  She is a lesbian and wants people to know it. As the doors begin to slide shut, a woman yells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!  Hold the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky pushes the "open" button.  A couple steps into the  elevator.  His name is CAESAR, a middle-aged Italian, wea an expensive suit and sunglasses. She is VIOLET; a piece of sexual candy that would melt in your mouth. She hears it again, a guttural sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again for this opportunity,  Mr. Bianchinni.  Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up the phone and walks toward the wall. As she gets closer, we hear a bed rocking, tapping agains the wall. The man's breathing grows more and more labored until fin it swells --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whining motor of a high-powered drain-rod. The spiral cable whips wildly, spiraling deeper into the drain, black goo splattering everywhere. The machine is so loud Corky almost cannot hear someone  pounding on the apartment door. Killing the motor, she stands and goes to the door. Behind the door is Violet, wearing jeans, a white T-shirt and cowboy boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  My name is Violet.  We sort of  met in the elevator --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  I'm Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you working in here and I  just wondered if you'd like a cup of  coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is holding two cups of coffee: one black, one with cr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Come on in.  Give me a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet steps inside as Corky goes back to the bathroom to wash off the drain dreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to Rajeev?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky calls from the bathroom, scrubbing her hands vigoro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rajeev, the man who usually works on  the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he went home to India, but as  far as I know he'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wipes her hands on her overalls, returning to the mai room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is temporary for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty much.  One day at a time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet hands her the cup of black coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guessed you were straight black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both sip from the piping hot mugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm ...  thanks, I needed this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure ...  but to be honest, I  did have a slightly ulterior motive  here.  I was wondering if I could  ask a small favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, see, I'm kind of a night person,  so I was wondering if it wasn't a  terrible inconvenience if you could  wait a bit before using power tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't your fault.  The walls  here are just so thin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it really causes problems.   Sometimes it's like you're in the  same room.  But if it's too much  trouble, I understand ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no trouble.  There's other work  to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing everything yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is so amazing.  I'm in awe of  people who can fix things.  My dad  was like that.  We never had anything  new.  Whenever something broke he  would open it up, tinker with it and  it would work.  His hands were magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Corky's hands cupped around the mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah ...  I bet your car is twenty  years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truck.  Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '63 Chevy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do you know the owner, Mr.  Bianchinni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't, really.  I was referred to  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky suddenly feels she has revealed something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but Caesar does.  He likes him.   Says he's a good Italian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, no.  I'm not the marrying  kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling, she says nothing else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be going.  You can drop the  cup off anytime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CORKY watches her leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dirty bar hidden away on a dark street, its cracked, mo white sign the only evidence it exists. Corky's truck swings into a space in front of a couple of large motorcycles.  She flips her collar and heads for th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smell of leather and cigarette smoke fills Corky's no as she crosses to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, well ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sits as the fat bartender waddles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been awhile, Cork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years, two months, sixteen days.   How you doing, Sue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky puts a cigarette in her mouth and lights it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like shit.  Now that we're all caught  up, how about a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue opens the refrigerator and pulls out two Old Styles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They click the bottles together and drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a job yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Some plumbing, painting and  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean a J-O-B.  A real job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me, Sue.  I'm straight and  narrow.  I'm just here to get laid  or drunk and hopefully both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky gets off the stool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking around, she sees a woman alone at one of the back tables.  Through the smoky din, she bears a slight resemb to Violet. The woman is dressed all in black, including a leather ja Smiling, Corky slides into the chair beside her.  There i no one smoother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know ...  that outfit would look  great on my bedroom floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman smiles just as someone taps Corky on the should She turns and is face-to-face with a large bull of a woma in a heavy leather Chicago Police jacket.  She is more wi than fat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jesse.  What's happening here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing ...  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her coat opens as she puts her hands on her hips.  A serv revolver is clipped to her belt. She squints at Corky, her head nodding in recognition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you were out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky smiles at the woman in black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you get tired of Cagney and  Lacey, come find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She heads for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neighborhood would be politely described as "rough."  Corky's truck does not stand out parked alone on the litt street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is a hole but it is home. Corky is lying on her futon staring up at the ceiling, a  beer resting on her stomach; a folk singer quietly croons from the radio. We see the ceiling, a circle of light hovering over the s desk lamp.  We move in on the spot, which slowly fills up the screen until there is nothing but the white light. Suddenly a wet paint roller loaded with white paint cuts swath across the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky is painting the ceiling.  The folk ballad has becom an angry Riot Grrrl anthem. She is working hard, the roller sucking back and forth.   Sweat covers her face. Dropping the roller down, she reloads it in the tray when the phone rings.  She stops and answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Oh, hi, Mr. Bianchinni ...   yes, everything is going fine.  I  got the tub drain all cleaned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at the main wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, all right, I guess I could  take a look.  Yeah, you're welcome,  goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and looks again at the wall, feeling...  cur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky knocks and after a moment Violet opens the door.  S seems surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.  Shit.  I didn't know he would  call you.  God, you must think |I'm  a total nuisance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I usually would call  Rajeev, but I didn't know what to do  so I called Mr. Bianchinni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said you lost something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps back and Corky walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet leads her through the apartment.  It is expensivel furnished with very masculine tastes; a lot of gray and b leather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing some dishes and just as  I pulled the stopper my earring fell  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky looks at her blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of my favorites.  That's  why I got upset.  I know it probably  seems ridiculous to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eyebrow goes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, look, forget it.  I  shouldn't have called...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told Bianchinni I would take a  look.  Is it that sink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet nods. She opens the sink cabinet and pulls out a pair of channe locks from her back pocket.  The teeth of the channel loc open and bite onto the pressure nut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a pot or a bucket?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands one down to her.  Corky slides it under the cur pipe. As she works, Corky feels herself staring at Violet, at t hem of her dress curving tightly around her thighs. Water begins to trickle into the pan. The nut slides loose and Corky tips the trap.  Water spla into the pan with a soft metal "tink."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky fishes into gray water and pulls out the earring. Violet screams, a huge smile on her face, half-falling as she tries to hug Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it!  You did it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky leans back under and replaces the trap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.  You have to let  me pay you something --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Mr. Bianchinni asked me to do  it.  I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky checks the drain by running the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you won't take money, how about a  drink?  It's getting late.  You can't  work all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky eyes her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, one drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beer.  Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and turns to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sits on the black leather couch and Violet returns  with two bottles of Heineken.  Corky sneers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink the bottles and swig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seem uncomfortable.  Do I make  you nervous, Corky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Violet, then takes another long pull on the  bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirsty, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet smiles, her eyes again talking for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious?  That's funny, I'm feeling  a bit curious myself right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet notices the tattoo on Corky's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great tattoo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches over and touches it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful labrys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky is a bit suprised that she knows what it is.  She n rubbing it as if trying to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you surprised that I know what  it is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a tattoo, would you like to  see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves closer, sliding over the leather cushions as sh opens the front of her dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman in upstate New York did it  for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is not wearing a bra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.  Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Set against the soft white skin of her breast is a bright green-stemmed violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It took her all day to do it.  She  promised me it wouldn't hurt, but it  was sore for a long time after.  I  couldn't even touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky looks up from Violet's breast to her dark eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now I love the way it feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She runs her fingers softly over the slightly scarred ski

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, touch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky feels the blood pounding in her ears as Violet take her hand and places it on her breast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it obvious?  I'm trying to  seduce you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I want to.  I've wanted to  since I first saw you in the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky watches her, trying to figure her out even as her t presses into Violet's nipple. Inhaling sharply, Violet closes her eyes; she can feel Co staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me.  But I can  prove it to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes Corky's wrist and begins pulling her hand down body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't believe me because of what  you see ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She forces Corky's hand between her legs, up under her dr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you can believe what you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet opens her eyes, a wanton smile on her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see ...  I've been thinking about  you all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky's forearm flexes and Violet moans. With both hands, Violet takes hold of Corky's forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You planned this whole thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet's head swims; she is unable to breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dropped that earring down the  drain on purpose, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I say yes, will you take your  hand away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it is Corky who smiles. Violet shivers, her thighs rubbing, her hips thrusting ag Corky's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Corky ...  please ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes barely open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  kiss me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a single motion, Corky takes hold of the back of her n and covers Violet's open mouth with her own. With her hand still stuffed between Violet's legs, Corky  lays her back onto the couch as the kiss becomes more -- More desperate, more hungry until -- We hear the front door unlock and open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet's eyes pop open and she pushes Corky back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet, you home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble to compose themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  In here, C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes around the corner and in the dim light sees the figures sitting close on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He mistakes Corky for a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stands as Caesar barrels toward the couch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't expect --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky stands and turns, Caesar suddenly realizing that sh is a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, this is Corky.  Corky, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Christ, I thought ...   it's fucking dark in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches to the wall for the lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is working for Bianchinni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, right.  Don mentioned  that to me.  Hi, welcome to the  family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're helping Rajeev?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Rajeev's in India.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's doing the work herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.  Bianchinni hired you?  You  know he's a good friend of mine.   |Family, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what Violet said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her as if he knows something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you just got out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Caesar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  It ain't no big fuckin' deal.   I know who Don hires.  Did you know  he did time himself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen fucking years.  See, there  ain't no secrets here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky doesn't like this man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many'd you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He whistles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad.  What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's none of your goddamn business,  Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.  You don't have to  tell me, if you don't want to.  I  just hope you understand you're among  good people here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches into his pocket and pulls out a thick fold of  money and peels several hundreds.  Corky stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on.  if you understand  what I'm talking about you're going  to take the money.  if you don't,  I'm going to have to worry about  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky takes it.  Caesar smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  I hate to worry.  I got ulcers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  How about a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brushes, I have to clean my  brushes.  Thanks, though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the paintbrush, Corky's fingers pushing through separating the black bristles under the running water. When the brush is clean, she flicks it dry and resets the edge. She goes to the sink to wash her hands when she stops,  noticing her left hand. It is the hand that was between Violet's legs. She is about to smell her finger when she sees herself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drops her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing?  I'm fucking up,  that's what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scrubs her hands clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is late, the area burnished with amber street light.   Corky walks from the building to her truck. She climbs inside and slides the key into the ignition, w suddenly the passenger door opens and -- Violet gets in.  Stunned, Corky stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't think this is a good  idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't apologize, please.  I can't  stand women who apologize for wanting  sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not apologizing for what I did --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slides across the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm apologizing for what I didn't  do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses Corky, and if Corky is trying to resist, we ca tell. The windshield is beginning to steam when Violet, panting breaks the kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a bed somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unable to speak, Corky reaches over and starts the engine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sex. There is nothing flower-scented or out-of-focus about it. It is sweaty, slippery, body-grinding, bed-squeaking lesb sex -- Pungent and potent -- And when it is over, neither woman can move. Finally, Corky's eyes flutter open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet smiles. Slowly, Corky gets up and goes to the fridge.  She grabs beer and presses it to her sweating forebead. After a moment, she lowers it, gently pressing the cold c elsewhere.  Eyes closed, she lets out a long "Ahh." Violet hears the sizzle-pop of the beer as Corky returns the bed. She holds the beer to Violet's lips and tilts the can,  watching Violet's throat as she drinks. Violet's eyes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  I needed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky hands her the beer as Violet sits up a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar's Mafia, isn't he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to ask?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, nobody calls it that anymore.   Caesar calls it "The |Business."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you meet him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took over a club I was working  at.  Caesar started managing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a launderer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost five years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years is a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky stares at her beer.  She knows what Violet is think

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redistribution of wealth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what you wanted to know?   What I did time for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The redistribution of wealth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I tell someone when I'm  trying to get them in my bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already in your bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My cellmate would say she did her  time for getting caught.  She was  always more honest than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sips her beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started stealing when I was little.   We were piss-poor, which is not an  excuse, just a fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It isn't like her to talk about this, especially with som she just met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time I remember so vividly.   A bunch of us kids were at Waxman's  Drugstore, when Mr. Waxman, who was  a mean old prick, always worrying  about us robbing him, dropped a roll  of quarters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can almost hear the coins tinkling on the tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can still hear that sound, those  quarters, because right then something  clicked inside of me.  Some instinct  took over and as everyone, including  Waxman, dove down, I reached up and  emptied the cash register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet smiles.  She likes this woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gave most of the money to my mom.   I told her I found it at the  trainyard.  She was so happy she  cried, calling me her lucky charm.   Fifteen years later, I guess my luck  ran out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sbe swallows that with beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I tell myself that I didn't  have a choice, that stealing was  surviving.  Usually I can admit that's  bullshit.  I did it because it was a  way out.  It was easy and I was good  at it, real good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't usually talk this much.  I  guess I have been rehabilitated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't have to tell me if you  didn't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. PARKING LOT DAY
dialogues.text: Corky gets out of her truck carrying her tools.  Grinning like someone who has been well-laid, she whistles off to  work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between the main doors she sees a man.  His name is SHELL and he is an overdressed accountant. He is very nervous, talking to someone through the interc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's gone.  Please.  I have  to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiddling with her keys, Corky recognizes the voice that  answers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly glances over his shoulder at Corky, answering in a hushed voice.

dialogues.speaker: SHELLY
dialogues.text: I have to leave.  Tonight. For a moment the intercom is silent.  Then the door buzze and Shelly pushes inside.  Corky follows him to the eleva

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky glares at Shelly and begins pumping the trigger of circular saw. Shelly hides behind his sunglasses, watching the elevator numbers go up.  The doors open and he scurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him enter Caesar's apartment, her smile now  completely gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is later.  Through the wall we listen to the same soun as before of two people making love.  We drop down and fi Corky's brush, still wet with paint, abandoned in her tra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her face glistening with sweat, Violet climaxes, letting orgasm spread through her like melting butter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had this image of you, inside of  me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flattens her palms against the soft cradle of her pel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a part of me ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she opens her eyes, we see that her lover is Corky.  V watches as she gets off the bed and begins to get dressed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky does not answer as she yanks her pants on.  Violet  sits up.  She can feel that something is wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet pulls the sheet around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes there is.  I felt it this morning  when I brought you the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't want to see me, did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is one thing I can't stand  about sleeping with women, it's all  the fucking mind reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!  You can't understand, because  we're different, Violet.  We're  different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not that different, Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you sit in that bed and say  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess.  This is where you  tell me that what matters is on the  inside.  That inside you, there is a  little dyke just like me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, she's nothing like you.  She's  a lot smarter than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what her daddy tells her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I am.  I don't need to  have it tattooed on my shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?  That you don't  have sex with men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, Violet!  I heard  you!  Thin walls, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What you heard wasn't sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All my life, everyone has been telling  me that when I have sex, I'm not  really having sex.  Not real sex.   But they're wrong.  I know what is  and isn't sex and what you heard was  definitely not sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That knocks Corky back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made certain choices in your  life that you paid for.  You said  you made them because you were good  at something and it was easy.  Do  you think you're the only one that's  good at something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stare pins Corky to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make our own choices and we pay  our own prices.  I think we're more  alike than you want to admit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that guy this morning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Shelly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me, you're a workaholic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Shelly knows what I am.  He saw  me in a bar with another woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose he just wants to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all Violet can take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it!  I think you better leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to steal anything on the way  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That stings but Corky walks out without looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is dark now.  Corky is standing above the paint tray t has skinned over.  She picks up the brush.  It is dry wit paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws the brush across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A green-and-white street sign juts in the foreground of  Caesar's upscale apartment building. The sign reads: "FRANKLIN STREET."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rusty Chevy glides to a stop in a parking space near service entrance.  In its payload is a boxed bathroom van and sink. Corky climbs out of the cab and into the back, unhooking bungee cords that hold down the boxes. She looks up as a black Lincoln Town Car screeches into a spot not far from her truck.  THREE SERIOUS-LOOKING MEN g out, leading a fourth, Shelly. He is the only one who seems to notice Corky. They enter the building, the door closing behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky's legs jut out from the old wicker vanity as she  finishes detaching its anchors and pipe work. She stands, giving it a yank and pulling it away from the wall, when voices begin to filter in from the next-door  apartment. She listens - a rising string of warbling sobs drowned ou by an angry voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!  You piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to tell us!  You're  going to fuckin' tell us!  just a  matter of fuckin' time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each sentence is punctuated with grunts and thuds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?  Where the fuck is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We begin to close in on Corky as she listens to each thud watching something that disturbs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shit!  You piece of shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With each thud the water in the toilet shimmers like a st cymbal.  As we move closer, the sound swells until --

dialogues.speaker: INT. CAESAR'S BATHROOM DAY
dialogues.text: Where blood splatters the toilet, heavy drops hitting the water and spreading like inverted mushroom clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did that hurt?  News flash, fucko:  I'm just getting started.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The angry voice belongs to JOHNNIE MARZZONE.  Shelly is  kneeling in front of the toilet, hands tied behind his ba with electrical wire. Johnnie Marzzone is a flashy young man in Armani slacks,  silk shirt and silver-tipped cowboy boots.  His tie is tu in, as if torture were a fine-dining experience. Caesar and two other men are crammed in the small bathroo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got nerve trying to fuck us!   Nobody fucks me!  Nobody fucks my  father!  Nobody!  Nobody!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly screams as Jobnnie repeatedly rams his face into t toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa.  Come on, he's making  too much noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, bitch?  Be quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, put this in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar hands a towel to Johnnie, who stuffs it into Shell mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Corky, Violet can hear the beating.  She is trying t block it out but cannot. Standing at the bar, she runs the blender, grinding ice c trying to drown out the sounds of the bathroom. The bathroom door opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prick!  I can go all night!  All  night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar steps out, shutting the door, masking the sounds b him.  Violet moves toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Oh, come on, I didn't use one  of the good towels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens again as someone else steps out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, I'm serious.  This is too  much.  I have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  'Cause you know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You women are so fucking sensitive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes hold of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't want you to go.  I like  you here.  You know this isn't easy  for me, either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He embraces her.  Over his shoulder she sees MICKEY MALNA in the hallway, staring at her. He is an older man, hair graying, built like a fireplug. Sinewy mass strains at his Brooks Brothers suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now why don't you go watch some TV  or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay, Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey, why is Johnnie here?  You  know how I feel about that fucking  psycho.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey continues to stare at Violet, who looks up at him  with her big doe eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, didn't I tell you to get  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mickey.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes to the kitchen. Mickey moves closer to Violet, lifting her chin the way a father would do to his little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have to see this.  Why  don't you get out of here?  Go for a  walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar wants me to stay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about Caesar.  I'll handle  Caesar.  You just get out of here,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar returns from the kitchen.  He is holding a pair of tin snips.  Mickey takes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, C.  Now let's end this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet watches them return to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey takes off his coat and hands it to a large man nam LOU.  He slaps Johnnie on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Johnnie, ease up, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie hits Shelly once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie checks his hair in the mirror, carefully.  Then h begins putting on the rings he had removed for the beatin Mickey kneels down next to Shelly's ear and motions to Lo who lifts Shelly's bound arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly, I'm going to ask you ten  times.  You understand?  Ten times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey grabs Shelly's pinky finger, putting it between th metal blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One.  Where is our money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly whimpers, red-faced and sobbing.  There is a sick  crunch and Shelly howls into his gag as his pinky finger  bounces to the floor amid the expensive leather footwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw ...  Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Caesar retrieve a tissue and his hand enters the  frame, scooping up the pinky. He plunks the severed finger into the toilet and it sinks the bottom. Caesar drops the toilet seat down and flushes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky can't stand it anymore.  She throws her tools down, leaves the bathroom and finds -- Violet waiting in the main room.  Both women stand apart silence. Violet seems on the verge of saying something but doesn't know how to start.  Her lip begins to quiver; her eyes se the room, returning to Corky each time. The violence in the next room can still be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet?  Are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost unnoticeably, Violet shakes her bead.  Corky puts arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the kind of bar businessmen drink at in the afterno Dark wood and padded leather. The bartender, joking with a cluster of men, does not not Corky as she moves up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bartender glances over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Draft beer and a TNT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky eyes the men, who stare into their drinks. The bartender says nothing as he puts the drinks in front her. Corky heads for her table, ignoring the whispers and snic Corky and Violet, the only women in the room, sit close  together at a far corner table. Violet's voice is hushed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly was skimming from the business.   He came to see me yesterday because  he was afraid Caesar figured it out.   He wanted to run but he wanted me to  come with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even though he knew about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was in love with you, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he told himself.  But it  wasn't even about me, it was about  Caesar.  He wanted what Caesar had.   That's how they are.  I understand  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances around the room; a man at the bar smiles at h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Shelly, taking the money was a  way to take from Caesar.  He could  have run at any time, but he didn't  because he didn't want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like he wanted to get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he did.  He would brag to me  all the time.  He was never afraid  of Caesar because he didn't know  him.  Not like I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two men sit down near them, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar lives for these moments.  He  tells me it's just the business, but  I know it's more than that.  He likes  it.  The violence.  I'll catch him  in the bathroom mirror touching his  scars.  He says they remind him who  he his.  They're all like that.   Except maybe Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the part of the business that  the rest of them pretend to be.   |But Mickey doesn't like it like  they do.  I suppose that's why he's  good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stares at her glass, at the melting ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be able to block it out.   I would tell myself that I wasn't  really there so nothing really  mattered.  But I can't do it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She downs the last of her drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been making the same mistake  Shelly made.  But now I know what |I  want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want out.  I want a new life.  I  see what I've been waiting for, but  I need you, Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made a choice once.  Do you think  you would make that same choice again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If those quarters fell to the floor,  would you still reach up to that  cash register?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky stares at her, knowing where this is going.  She gl around the crowded bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky's truck sits in a gravel parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the back window of the truck, Violet and Corky ar silhouettes against the street light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is going to get the money and  bring --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shelly said it was over two million  dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky quietly swallows that pill.  It begins to rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar will bring it to the apartment  to count and go through |Shelly's  books to figure out how he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.  Wait a minute.  Do  you have any idea what you are saying?   You are asking me to help you fuck  the mob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These people are serious, Violet.   If you want to know how serious, ask  Shelly.  They're worse than any cop  because they have lots of money and  no rules.  You fuck them, you've got  to do it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I need your help.  You  said you were good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, but ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows Violet is challenging her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, let's say for the moment  that I believe everything you are  saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm lying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that, but since you  did, let's say that you are.  It  would have been easy to set Shelly  up.  You could have got him killed  knowing that Caesar would bring the  money to the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stares, her face poker-blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you would need to keep yourself  clean would be someone unconnected,  someone like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just making a point.  You have  no idea what you're asking.  How  much trust two people need to do  something like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves closer to Violet, the sound of the rain beating against the metal cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me, stealing is a lot like sex.   Two people that want the same thing  sit in a room and they talk, they  start to plan and it's like flirting,  a kind of foreplay, because the more  they talk about it, the wetter they  get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The difference is, I can have sex  with someone I just met, someone I  hardly know, but to steal I need to  know someone like I know myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you know me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are close enough to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But first, I want to see this money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet springs from the couch as the front door crashes o Caesar charging in.  He is doubled over, clutching someth to his stomach. He rushes to the kitchen, dumping a bloody bundle into th double sink.  There is blood everywhere, smeared up and d Caesar's front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet takes a step toward him, unsure of what has happen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.  It ain't mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls a bottle of whiskey and a glass from the cupboar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was unbelievable!  Un-fucking- believable!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pours himeslf a shot, belting it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, look at this shirt!  It's  ruined!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins unbuttoning the bloody shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started when Shelly took us to  the money.  I tell you, Mickey Malnato  knows his shit, he does.  Shelly  takes us right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws down another shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Shelly's down on his knees and  he's pulling out this bag of money  from a safe in the floor and I'm  staring at it like "holy fuck!" I  mean, look at it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tears open the bloody bag, wet money bricks spilling o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all I can think is how the fuck  did he do this when - Bang!  Johnnie  caps him.  Blood sprays everywhere,  all over the money.  We've no idea  if this is even all of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And right then I go through the roof  and - Boom!  I belt the dumb fuck as  hard as I can.  I didn't care whose  son he was, I just wanted to hit him  again.  Knock some sense into that  dumb son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the pile of bloody money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at this mess I got to deal  with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them to run it through the  cycles.  But I guess Gino has plans  for it because he's coming here  tomorrow night to pick this shit up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Searching through a sink cabinet, he can't find what he n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's the laundry  detergent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm ...  in the linen closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar walks down the ball to the bathroom.  Violet's eye do not move from the pile of money. Corky seems to come from nowhere.  She whispers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come to my place in the morning.   Early, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky's hands twitch, and then flex against the ropes tha bind them. A reflex echoes through her body, muscles spasm and limbs jerk against their bonds. As if in a dream, she struggles, trying to get free, figh toward the edge of consciousness until -- She seems to succumb, slipping back into stillness. We move toward her face, her closed eyes as we again hear the voices in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having second thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is on the bed, Corky at the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he washed the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what?  Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hung it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To let it dry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to focus on the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was unreal ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving in on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benjamin Franklin's face on a hundred-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franklin's face rotates as we pull back, seeing rows of b carefully paper-clipped to lines of string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds, paper-clipped everywhere  like leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes filled with green, Violet turns inside the laundry l of money until she sees Caesar. Wearing his undershirt, he is across the room standing at the ironing board, ironing every single bill. He seems to have one eye on her, one eye on his work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one by one, he ironed all of  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sprays starch across several bills and presses the ste iron to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he sleep?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is in bed, unable to sleep, listening to the machi shuffle of Caesar's bill counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move past her, floating toward the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All night long I listened to that  sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drift across Caesar's desk, past bricks of bound bills as Caesar folds the paper tape around another stack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the counter again and we hear the sound, now very loud as hundreds blur by, fluttering beneath us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound rolls into thunder --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems to shake the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is it now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his office.  I saw it this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet cautiously enters the office with a cup of coffee. Working furiously at the computer, Caesar jumps when he s her, bloodshot eyes animal-wide. He checks his watch as she sets the coffee in front of hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to go to the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods automatically, back in his work, as she sees the  briefcase filled with perfect rows of hundreds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in a case, on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the case lock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the open top with its silver flip-over locks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is trying to remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky begins to pace, ordering the information in her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, now, tell me about Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sounded like he and Caesar don't  like each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like each other?  They hate each  other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started way before I was around.   I think basically it's because he  thinks Johnnie is a complete idiot.   But Johnnie runs Chicago because  Gino is his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is Gino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet suddenly feels that she has made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino Marzzone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marzzone?  As in Angelo Marzzone,  head of the Marzzone family?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky covers her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino Marzzone is coming tonight to  pick up the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Johnnie is his son, that's Johnnie  Marzzone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eyes wide, she paces, pulling at her lip, mumbling. Suddenly she freezes as it clicks into place.  She looks Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pacing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino Marzzone is coming to your  apartment.  It's a big deal, isn't  it?  That means Caesar will be ready.   He doesn't want to look like an idiot.   Gino has been there before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, twice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not much, really.  Caesar was nervous,  kept cleaning the apartment.  |The  first time, he picked out the dress  he wanted me to wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something occurs to Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Johnnie hit on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie hits on anything in high  heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Caesar ever seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does it right in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting better and better.   Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino doesn't know English, or at  least he pretends he doesn't, so he  doesn't talk much.  He gets right to  the point.  Both times they talked  for about five minutes, had one drink  and then they left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did Gino drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotch, Glenlivet.  I remember that  Caesar made a huge deal about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky smiles, the wheels rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns from the window and gets onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an idea to make this work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is getting dressed, lining her lips with lip-penci

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll go back and get ready, take  your time, make it real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she works on her face, we see the room behind her and discarded dresses scattered about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more attractive you are, the  more believable it will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky breaks her thought-train.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time did you say they would be  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The plane is in at seven, so I'd say  about eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any bodyguards?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino travels with a big man named  Roy.  Caesar calls him the driver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar again checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At some point Caesar is going to  quit.  I'd guess sometime around  six, making sure he's got time to  get ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The watch reads 6:10.  Caesar rubs his eyes, his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is at the bar in a sexy dress and high heels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-fucking-believable, what this guy  did.  Shelly is one smart-ass  mothefucker, I mean, he was one smart- ass motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs as Violet smiles, handing him an enormous drink

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as he is done, you'll be  right there to put a big drink in  his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want him to come down, to relax,  feel in control again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Poor boy, has to work so hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a woman's sympathy pout; he knows what it,  loves it anyway. Smiling, he slides his hand down over her ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look good enough to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and waits for the kiss she knows is coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both women are starting to feel it, to believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where will you be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting in the apartment next door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sits on the floor of the dark apartment.  She has t off her boots, which are beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the wall we can hear the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the shower.  That will be our  signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky opens a thin box filled with needle-thin lock picks She selects several and slips them into her multi-pierced ears like earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he's done with his shower, you  will go to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In slow motion, Caesar drops the shower plunger and water chokes from the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the bar, Violet pulls out the bottle of Glenlivet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get out the Scotch that Gino  drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet steps out from the bar, her eyes on the bedroom, w the bottle slips from her hands. We watch it slowly fall --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as you do, the bottle will slip  from your hands.  -- and shatter  against the hardwood floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!  Oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar yells from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing Caesar, Corky gets up, moving quietly toward the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V!  What the fuck was it?!  Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar enters, a towel wrapped around him, hair still  dripping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: V, what?  You can't hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet looks terribly upset as she begins to clean up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, it slipped ...  I was trying  to get ready ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar realizing what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fucking Christ ...  You gotta be  kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!  Fuck!  How did you ...  Awwww  goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  It was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll get some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be silly, Caesar.  It'll take  five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns him back toward the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll clean this up and be back before  you're even dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet opens her door, stepping into the hall where Corky waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you open the door, I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass each other in silence, Violet stepping out as C slips in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he sees you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is working intensely on his fingernails.  We glide over a set of gleaming metal manicure tools.  We see his  hand as he delicately applies a coat of clear polish to a nail. Through the open door, we see Corky moving almost casuall across the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky is looking for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't know for certain that he  won't see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds a black duffel bag from one of her tool buckets

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just asking, what if?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he does ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky slips her hand in between the mattress and box spri pulling out a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I won't have a choice, will I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tosses the gun on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The black case is lying on the desk, locked shut.  Corky  moves around the desk, dropping down behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I'm inside, I will get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From her earlobe, she chooses the right pick, sliding out the silver tool. It takes only a second and the first lock pops open. She is working on the other lock when the door is pushed  open and Caesar walks in. Corky drops down, grasping for her gun -- As Caesar, wearing only underwear, enters.  He blows on t drying polish on his fingernails before delicately select a suit from his closet. The gun ready, Corky, pressed against the desk, waits unt he leaves. She lets her breath out, then pops the second lock, unzip the black duffel bag and quickly empties the case, fillin the bag with fat money bricks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to need something ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finished, she zips up the bag and looks about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  to fill the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sbe sees a stack of newspapers hidden near the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you should hide it near the  desk before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fills the case, then closes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At that point --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thumbs the locks shut and they snap, unnaturally loud into place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are both on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no going back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I get the Scotch, how do I know  you won't take off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same way I'll know that you went  to Scotch.  Trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their faces are close, eyes still trying to read each oth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't see how I'm going to  get clean with the money in the  apartment.  Everyone will think I  did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of what you are going to  tell him.  You have to make it as  real as you can.  The moment you  open the door with the Scotch in  your hand, you will be covered, and  that moment is the most important  moment in the plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door bursts open.  Violet enters quickly, carrying a  bottle in a thin brown bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's real enough, he'll believe  it, because deep down he'll want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C!  Shit, I'm sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar wanders out, tightening his tie.  She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were early.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just left, didn't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles, grabbing the bottle from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean they weren't up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  They're still on their way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I just saw Johnnie downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was getting out of the car when I  saw him in the Mercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It couldn't have been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was him.  I'm positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, I know Johnnie.  It was him.   I screamed when I saw him.  I couldn't  believe I missed them.  I knew you  were going to be upset so I thought  I'd apologize and give Gino the  Scotch.  I honked a couple of times  but he didn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him, her words caving in around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Gino's plane doesn't get in for  another half-hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I didn't see Gino in the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes dart.  His forehead beads with sweat.  He turns  toward the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet is staring at Corky's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Caesar hates Johnnie like you  say, then the second he opens the  case he'll know, in his gut, that  Johnnie just fucked him.  He'll  realize that he has no choice.  He  can't touch Gino or Johnnie.  There's  only one way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll have to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he runs, everyone will assume he  took the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be clean and we'll be rich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar stands over the desk, afraid to open the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're this goddamn smart, how  did you ever get caught?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every job like this has moments where  things don't go so well and everyone  starts thinking about their own ass.   It's in those moments that everything  comes together or falls apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks dead at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a partner and she fucked me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're going to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key turns and the locks pop.  When Caesar sees the  newspaper, the whole world begins to spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His chest collapses onto itself while his hands ball into fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No no no no ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She moves around the side of the desk and sees the newspa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the case shut, his head hanging down. After a moment he looks at her, like a little boy about t cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  I've been set up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems ready to scream but can't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The name is like water hitting hot oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fuck!  That rat-fuck!  Little  shit rat-fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts punching the desk, each blow harder than the la

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky can hear him pounding.  She looks down and smiles. Between her legs is the open bag stuffed with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is choking on his own rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Why would Johnnie do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Violet!  Open your  fucking eyes!  Johnnie hates me like  I hate him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to pound his fists against his own head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that little fuck!  I hate  him!  I hate him!  I should've done  him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know he did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?!  So fucking what?  Use  your head, Violet.  The money is  gone.  Gino is coming here to get  it.  You think he's going to believe  me if I tell him his piss-hole son  stole it!  Is that what you think?   I don't.  You know what I think?  I  think I'm a dead man.  I'm one in  the brain.  That's what I think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
