dialogues.text: He grabs hold of his chair, using it to support himself

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what he wants me to do.  He  wants me out of here.  He wants me  to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches him, his body rocking against the chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I run, then everyone will think I  took the money and he walks away  with two million clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The words squeeze out like tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I can see him right now driving  to get Gino.  I can hear him laughing,  fucking laughing, laughing at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the swivel chair over his head and smashes it d on the desk.  Again and again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing at me!  Laughing at me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair falls and he stands alone, covering his face to hide his tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She goes to hold him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs into the corner of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just leave me alone!  I got to think!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet watches him trying to wipe the tears and sweat fro his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to think this through ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, maybe we should run --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it, Caesar, forget Johnnie,  forget the money, let's just go now,  before it's too late --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Violet!  Would you just  leave me the fuck alone!  Please!   Leave!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet enters, closing the door quietly behind her.  She  looks at the wall, then goes to the bed and picks up the  phone. As she dials, we move along the phone cord, following it  down to the jack in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move out from another jack, following a different cord Corky is sitting with her back to the wall.  The black ph beside her barely rings once before she answers. She waits, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: INT. BEDROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Violet whispers, her hand cupped over the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He totally freaked.  I've never seen  him like this.  He's out of his  fucking mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, as long as he believes  it was Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believes it!  Jesus, it's driving  him crazy.  He wants to kill him.  I  don't know, Corky, I don't know what  he is going to do.  I'm getting  nervous, really nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, Violet.  It's working.   All we got to do is wait him out and  see what he does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if he doesn't run?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means he probably will kill  Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ, I got to get out of here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, if he doesn't run, all you  have to do is break down, go to your  bedroom and pack some things, start  crying, saying you love him but you  can't do it.  You're sorry but you  have to leave and just walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: okay, all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost there, Violet.  just  hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet hears him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up quickly just as Caesar bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it!  I know what I got to do!   I got to get the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money?  The money's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Johnnie's got it.  All I got to  do is get it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it could be anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't have that much time.  He  had to pick up Gino.  I bet you he's  got it with him.  I bet it's in the  car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky presses against the wall, trying to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't see you, did he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, right now he doesn't know that  I know, that's why he put the paper  in the case.  He wants me to hand  the case to Gino.  Then there is no  doubt it was me.  Gino will put a  bullet in me himself.  But it ain't  going to happen.  I won't let it!   Johnnie ain't going to fuck me!  Not  like this!  No way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is insane!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She throws open her closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a suitcase from under the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm leaving!  This is crazy!  I don't  want to be involved.  I don't want  anything to do with this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts yanking the dresses from the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hell I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit!  You don't need me!  You've  never needed me!  I can't help you!   Understand?!  I have to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet, I won't let you leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and sees that he is holding a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're not with me, Violet, then  I have to assume you're against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, this is crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is, maybe it isn't.  Maybe  you dropped the Scotch by accident.   Maybe you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it is her turn to feel the world spin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would have been so easy to let  him in as you went out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't, you can't believe that  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen the way he looks at you.   He's always wanted you.  Maybe two  million dollars finally bought you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps him hard.  He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Violet, but it has to be  this way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves past her, picks up the dresses and returns them the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you understand.  I want to  trust you, I want to believe you,  but I don't have any other choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is at the bar, drinking the Scotch.  The gun in fr of him.  Across the room, Violet sits, staring holes thro him. They wait in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dark, Corky sits, her face, her posture very simil to Violet's. She is concentrating, her mind somewhere else, when the d buzzer sounds. She turns her head and hears Caesar faintly answering the intercom. Corky stands just as --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stands. Caesar faces her for a moment, then shoves the gun into h belt behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky watches through the door peep as three men pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a knock and Caesar opens the door. GINO MARZZONE is an old Italian whose face is a mask of  irritated indifference. ROY, his enormous driver, is behind him. Caesar smiles, greeting them in Italian with open arms. Johnnie is the last inside.  He has tape over his broken  nose.  He smiles and hugs Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have hit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to get into this now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, Caesar.  Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles again, patting him on the shoulder, then throwi a fake punch. Caesar sees Gino with his bright Italian smile, flatterin Violet, kissing her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Caesar!  You take care of this  girl, or I find out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are as radiant as ever, Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he bends to kiss her hand, she sees Caesar watching th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glenlivet, right, Gino?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have whatever Violet's drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not drinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then neither will I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This makes Violet very uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll have a Tanqueray and tonic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, make that two TNTs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar's hand shakes as he pours Gino's Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pacing in her socks, Corky tries to think through several possible situations.  She stops, staring at the bag of mo The idea of its sitting out in the open suddenly bothers  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar hands Violet and Johnnie a drink.  He stares at he She stares back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salud, eh.  Roy, Violet, Pop, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar watches Johnnie, suspecting everything he does. Johnnie reaches into his pocket and takes out a cellular  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Johnnie.  No goddamned phones.   Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, come here.  Sit.  We talk  now.  You too, Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each man sits on either side of Gino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, look at me.  Johnnie tell me  what happened.  Caesar, you gotta do  me a favor, a personal favor.  For  me, eh?  You gotta start respecting  Johnnie the way you respect me.  You  understand?  Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sees Johnnie smiling at him, but when Gino turns, smile disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you, Johnnie.  You gonna stop  acting stupid.  You gotta earn this  respect that Caesar's gonna give.   You understand?  Good.  Done.  Now,  where's my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky drops a hefty bag, knotted tight, into an open five gallon bucket of paint. As she picks up a paint stick, we see a second bag beside another bucket. She pushes the first bag down until it disappears, envelo by the milk-white liquid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar puts the briefcase onto the coffee table. Gino looks up at Caesar, very serious, with his hand on t case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know how this was done, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks dead at Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't happen again, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino throws down the last of the Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.  We go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Pop.  You got two hours  until your plane leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino checks his watch, shouting in Italian.  Johnnie shou back until Gino throws up his hands, refusing to listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures to his empty glass, then folds his arms, lean back.  Caesar gets the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Caesar, what did it total out at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two point one seventy-six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie whistles as Caesar pours Gino another Scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.  Can you believe that,  Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Johnnie ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Italian tells him to shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Pop, all I want to know is  one thing.  Just one thing after he  made such a big deal out of it.  I  bet it wasn't a big deal.  Was it,  Caesar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Johnnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money I bet it was nothing to  get it clean, after you made such a  fucking big deal ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie, what did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pop, this is important to me.  It's  a simple question.  if he would just  answer the question, that's the end  of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is this going, Johnnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just admit it, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admit what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you overreacted.  That you lost  it.  Not me.  It was your mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sees it so clearly now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, Johnnie, you want to play  it this way, I can play it this way.   You want to know who made a mistake,  why don't you open the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Violet!  This is between me  and Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the case toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to do this now, let's do  it.  Open the case.  Open the fucking  case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnnie stares at him, feeling that something is very wro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, I know.  I fucking  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the case!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right!  Where's the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries but it's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck can I open it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same way you did before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar smiles and tosses the key onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go, Johnnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the key.  Caesar stands up and gives Viole his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can see the fear on her face as she goes to the bar. Time drips. The key turns.  One lock pops. Then the other. Tbe case opens like a scream and Johnnie sees the newspap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before anybody can move, Caesar whips around with his gun Roy jumps off his stool, his drink crashing to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!  Don't fucking move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody can believe what is happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar?  What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask Johnnie!  Ask your rat-fuck son!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar levels the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I'll do it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're fucking crazy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, I don't know what you're  thinking here, but if you don't put  down that gun --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino, your son stole this money to  set me up and I can prove it.  Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them!  Tell them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, Johnnie, do what  he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't happening ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boom!  Caesar blows a hole in the couch right between  Johnnie's legs.  Johnnie screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The next one blows off your dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a dead man!  A fucking dead  man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gino jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aim a gun at me?!  Do you know  who I am?!  I am Gino Marzzone.  You  understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts walking toward Caesar.  Roy moves around for a  good angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Caesar, gimme the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He backs up as Gino walks straight to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're family, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches up and takes bold of the barrel.  Caesar looks resigned as he shuts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Gino's hand holding the gun barrel as -- Caesar fires. From behind the gun we watch Gino's grip yanked free, tim melting away as he falls, blood bubbling from his chest, eyes wide in disbelief. His body hits the floor and the room erupts. Roy dives, drawing his gun as Caesar continues to fire,  pumping the trigger. Violet drops behind the bar as Jobnnie screams, falling  towards his father. Blood spurts from Roy as two bullets hit, his gun clatter and sliding across the floor. Johnnie lunges at Caesar as Caesar turns and fires, hitti Johnnie everywhere; blood and meat spray and speckle  everything around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun continues to fire as Corky clutches the phone,  whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an emergency!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crunched down behind the bar, Violet listens to the only  sound, repeating in the unnatural quiet: Click.  Click. Click. Rising, she peers over the edge of the bar. Caesar is standing in the aftermath.  His gun is still ai at Johnnie as he pulls the trigger over and over. The bodies are still, blood silently pooling around them. Blinking the sweat from his eyes, Caesar sees Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to do it, Violet.  You saw it.   I had no choice.  It was Johnnie.   That lying fuck.  He made me do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks down at Jobnnie, hate rising like bile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lying rat-fuck.  You think you  can set me up?  Is that what you  think?  You stupid fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kicking the body, be causes a series of sickening wet noi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a dead man?  I'm a dead man?   Guess again, fuck-face.  Who's dead?   Who's the dead lying rat-fuck?  Take  another guess, take another fucking  guess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, panting, unable to catch his breath.  Violet is afraid to even look at him. Blood creeps along the edge of the floorboards. Caesar tries to clear his head, mopping the sweat from hi face.  He bends down and starts searching Johnnie's pocke He finds his keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lost in thought, he goes to Gino.  Throwing open the coat he sees the airplane ticket.  There is a bullet hole in i He checks the times and then his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  maybe three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, what are you going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we're going to do?   We have to find the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we have the money, then none of  this ever happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, you just killed Gino Marzzone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't.  Not if his body  disappears and not if the money is  still here.  Then they never showed  up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  We may never know,  but I'm going to guess it was a job,  maybe the Karpoli family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All part of the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up Roy's gun and stuffs it in his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got to find the money.  Once  we do, everything is going to be all  right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, the wail of a police siren can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the window they see a squad car, lights blaring,  roll up in front of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back to the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, what are we going to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just cops.  Stall them as  long as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar flies into action. Grunting, he hauls Gino's body up, drags it to the bathro and throws it into the tub.  He returns for Johnnie's bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing near the bathroom, Corky hears the metal echo of the tub.  Looking at her tub, she imagines what he is doi Through the wall, she hears the door buzzer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The buzzer sounds again as Violet sees him lift Roy's bod

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads back to the bathroom, dropping Roy onto the othe two. The three bloody bodies fill the tub. We see Johnnie's arm hanging over the edge as Caesar snap the shower curtain around, hiding them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the police, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts them off using the intercom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over her shoulder she sees Caesar moving the furniture,  clearing the area around the heavy bloodstains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a report of gunfire, so if  you could --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gunfire?  Is this a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet sees Caesar hurry to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No joke, ma'am.  Please open the  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I know you are cops?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar seizes the beautiful oriental rug in his office an yanks it up, overturning furniture.  Dragging it out, he  slams the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet looks at Caesar, who is working with the calm, sin minded focus of a machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am, you have to open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She buzzes them in as Caesar throws the rug like someone  making a bed, letting it fall to the floor and cover most the blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops are waiting for the elevator.  After a moment, t door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet moves away from the intercom as Caesar begins arra the furniture on the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me a wet towel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His words push her to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuffing a towel into the sink, she turns on the water. does not even look at the shower curtain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and the cops step out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar grabs the television remote, hits "on" and jacks t volume until it is obviously loud. Violet returns and he snatches the towel from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the two cops walk down the hall, they hear the televis They look at each other, already knowing what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a maniac, Caesar wipes at any blood still visible un there is a knock on the door.  He grabs Violet by the arm

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're thinking about doing  something stupid, remember I just  killed Gino Marzzone.  You understand  what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're just cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is another knock, much louder. Violet goes to the door as Caesar rips off his blood-soak jacket and shirt. He drops down behind the bar Leaving the chain on, Violet opens the door.  Tbe cops smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  We're for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's just you hear stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crouching, Caesar wipes vigorously at the blood on his ha and face. Violet opens the door. Caesar crams the bloody wad under the bar sink. Just as the cops enter the living room, Caesar stands, lo comfortable in no shirt, with ice cubes in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey, Chicago's finest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He plunks the ice into a glass and walks from behind the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going tonight, fellas?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar turns his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?  I'm sorry, I can only hear in  this ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tbe cops look at each other again. Wiping his wet hand on his pants, Caesar shakes hands wit each of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Caesar and this here is my Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at Violet as Caesar puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet said something about gunshots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet sees the gun wedged in the back of his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir, a neighbor in the building  called in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we know what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was probably just the television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The television?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, why didn't you say something?   Turn it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet walks across the rug and turns off the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, this happened before.  It's  this shitty ear.  Born with it.  The  batteries wore out in my aid.  I'm  sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all right, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No big deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, can I get you guys a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on duty, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But, uh, would you mind if I used  your bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar's face tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why not?  It's right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He heads for the john. Violet watches Caesar back up to the bar, moving behind i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make myself a drink, if  that's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go right ahead, sir.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM NIGHT
dialogues.text: Cop #2 enters, walking right past the shower curtain.  We hear his sigh as he starts to piss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #1 walks onto the rug, looking around, turning to Vio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a beautiful place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at his shoes on the rug. Watching everything, Caesar takes a sip of his drink.  He slips his gun out and holds it at his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a bulge in the shower curtain where we imagine  Johnnie's arm is hanging. Slowly we slide down to the bottom edge of the plastic  curtain, where a drip of blood forms and -- Plips into a small red spot on the white tile floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the heel of the cop's black shoe, where we can a see the blood seeping up through the oriental rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a condo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet nods. Everyone turns when Cop #2 busts out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cop #1 walks across the rug to the hardwood floor.  He tu to Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try to keep the extra batteries for  your aid around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky hears the cop say goodbye to Violet.  The door clos She isn't sure what she should do. Over her shoulder, she notes the bucket of paint.  She le the cops leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar puts on a new shirt, the gun stuffed in his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky rises at the sound of Caesar's door closing. We track her along the wall to the foyer as she follows t faint sounds of Caesar and Violet's footsteps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they pass by, Violet looks up to the door of the empty apartment, straight at the peephole. INT.  EMPTY APARTMENT Corky is pressed against the door, at the peephole. She sees that Violet is afraid as the two women seem to s to each other with their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is on his knees, searching under the seats of John Mercedes.  Unable to find the money, he is ready to snap. From the main doors, Corky slips out of the building.  Hi behind a column, she sees Violet and Caesar across the lo Corky moves behind the parked cars, the gun squeezed in h hand. Violet edges away, on the verge of running, looking towar the busy street. Standing, Caesar pounds on the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!  Fuck!  Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, someone could see us out  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignoring her, be tries to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still too far from them to do anytbing, Corky sees Caesar slam the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in!  It's got to be at his house.   That's the only other place it could  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet looks around the lot, looking for some way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky can only watch as Violet gets in and the car rips a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone, Corky stands over the bucket of paint.  She kicks with her boot-toe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million dollars, Cork ...  Two  million dollars ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, wondering how long she can make herself wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW is parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on Caesar, as he rakes his sweaty hair back, his fa knotted in torment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I come in ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns as if he just came in through the front door. We see Johnnie's home has been laid to waste.  The furnit is broken, cushions split open, pictures shattered, holes punched in the drywall -- even the carpeting has been tor up. Caesar doesn't look much better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the money ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huddled in a corner, Violet watches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't wait to see the look on  Caesar's face when he finds out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar moves from the front door, trying to get into John head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I don't have much time ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a couple of steps into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got to put it someplace safe ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at a closet.  It's gutted, searched 10 times alr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  put it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple more uneasy steps and he looks at a large over-t rolltop desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  got it ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts looking around the room as if he is seeing for first time that it is destroyed.  He is near the breaking point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His voice cracks.  There is nowhere else to look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did I put it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He explodes.  A terra cotta lamp sails across the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's my fucking money?!  Fucking  cocksuckers!  Where the fuck is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smashes his forehead into the wall, denting the drywal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds his head, sinking to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits next to him, putting a hand lightly on his shoul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not here, Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where, then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  it could be anywhere.   We don't even know if he was alone.   Please, Caesar, we don't have much  time.  Let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows what he has to do.  Digging through the debris, finds the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you going to call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already dialing, he does not answer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ceaar takes a deep breath, mustering composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar?  What the fuck time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick, I know it's late, but there is  a problem.  They haven't shown up  yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  They ain't there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't know where they are.  I  even called over at Johnnie's, but  no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  Let me call around.  I'll see  what I can do.  Don't go anywhere,  okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sure, Mick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, you still got the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar looks at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Mick.  I've got the money.   I'm staring right at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Sit tight.  I'll call you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar drags himself in.  Violet closes the door behind t Caesar moves into the room where it happened.  He is dizz and confused and does not want to be here. Violet turns him around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll start packing.  You know what  you have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns him toward the bathroom.  He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can use Johnnie's car, dump it in  Lake Michigan ...  I need plastic  bags ...  tape and rope ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nodding, he heads for the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet enters and goes straight for the phone.  She looks the blank wall as she dials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Corky ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings. When Corky answers, Violet almost collapses with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so afraid you ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't quit on me, Violet, and I  won't quit on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A box of Hefty bags tucked under his arm, a coil of  clothesline in his hand, Caesar searches through several  cabinets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet glances at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky, it worked!  He's going to  run.  He needs to take care of the  bodies to buy himself time, but as  soon as he leaves, it's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky falls against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: just a little longer and it's ours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mumbling to himself, Caesar walks out of the kitchen, hea for the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet reaches out and touches the wall, as if she were  touching Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky, I have to tell you something  ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky turns to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Violet.  I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her fingers gently touch the wall as we travel up and ove where we see they are actually touching the wall in the e same place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's why I'm still here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Violet hears Caesar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he opens the door, she slams down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line cuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fear and panic paralyze Violet as Caesar drops everything grabbing for his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He levels the gun at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stands and be rushes at her, grabbing her by the thro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that Mickey?  Did you call Mickey?   Did you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head and he throws her on the bed.  The gu aimed at her, he picks up the phone and -- Hits the redial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsure of what happened, Corky hears the phone ring and  answers it on reflex. Listening, she waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar listens, waiting as long as he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey?  Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky hangs up, jumping away from the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar hits the redial again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicking, Corkydoesn't answer it, but as it rings very l in the empty apartment, she realizes her mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning slowly toward the wall, Caesar hears the phone ri in the empty apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky rips the plug out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The line goes dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?  Who is over there?!   Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to get away, but he grabs her and slaps her to ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky hears Violet scream and that does it.  Gun in hand, she flies at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the empty apartment slams shut and Caesar, he it, starts to run -- But Violet reaches out, catching his ankle, sending him  crashing to the dresser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!  Just run!

dialogues.speaker: INT HALL
dialogues.text: The door to Caesar's apartment is locked.  Corky falls to one knee, whipping two lock picks from her earlobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar raises the gun to pistol-whip Violet and she screa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working the lock, Corky hears Violet's scream cut off. She feels the tumblers click, and rotates the cylinder. A shadow stirs under the crack of the door as she hears  something that sounds like footsteps.  Corky freezes. Corky presses down low against the door beneath the peeph She can almost feel Caesar beyond the door, but grits her teeth and turns the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door cracks open and Corky slips in, gun-first.  As s moves into the room, we see Caesar behind her. He puts his gun to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the fucking gun or die!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rising from her crouch, she turns and he recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!?  Holy fucking Christ!  You  gotta be kidding me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to laugh when she strikes -- Knocking the gun, she punches him, slamming him back agai the door as -- She twists, diving, grabbing her gun, just as -- He steps and kicks her full in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still unconscious, Corky's head jerks, reacting to the ki We see the dried blood caked to her check where his kick  split the skin.  She is again swimming toward consciousne We hear water splash, her face flinching as we move close the sounds and voices echoing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!  Come on, you fucking dyke!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear Caesar slapping her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky's face is dripping with water as her eyes slowly bl open. Coming into focus is Caesar, standing over her with an em glass in one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for the gag, she is bound as we have seen her boun in the closet. Caesar yanks out his gun and puts it to her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know everything now so I don't  want to hear any "I don't know"  bullshit, you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Violet on the bed, also bound hand and foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I should have seen this coming!   The second I met you, I knew it.   Everyone knows your kind can't be  trusted!  Fucking queers make me  sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gun digs into her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you tried to fuck the wrong guy.   And I swear to you that I'm going to  kill you for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumbs back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't kill you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims the gun at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not until he has the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fires and she jumps as the bullet punches through the  wall behind her. His point made, he puts the gun back to Corky's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, where the fuck is my money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lick me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either pull the trigger or get that  thing out of my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood temperature rising again, Caesar pulls the gun back and slaps her with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stupid cunt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, stop acting like an asshole  and think --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't try to tell me what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need the money just like we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let us go and we'll make a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes at her, grabbing a fistful of her hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do to her?!  This isn't  my Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her as if unable to recognize her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she do to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything you couldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shoves her down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ungrateful bitch!  You had nothing  before I met you.  You were nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stomps around the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave you this place?  This  apartment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He throws open the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who gave us all of this?  I did!  I  gave you everything!  I gave you  this life!  I made you, Violet.  I  saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems to believe what he is saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!  What a load of crap.  Look at  yourself, Caesar.  You're a thug.   |You launder money for the mob.  You  rent women like you rented this  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't want to hear this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saved me?  You don't even know me.   You used me, Caesar, just like I  used you.  All part of the business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You betrayed me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You murdered Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.  You made me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit, you killed him.  Not me.   You did it because you couldn't stand  the thought of Johnnie fucking you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you want business, I'll give  you the fucking business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make you beg just like  Shelly did.  Just like Shelly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He storms out of the room. Corky looks up at Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Corky ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry.  Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls at the ropes as Violet slides off the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar throws open the broom closet and grabs the clipper that Mickey used to cut off Shelly's finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two women are back-to-back, fingers working at each  other's knots when Caesar bursts into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no no no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing Corky by the boots, he drags her and flips her s that she can now see Violet. He drops down onto Violet putting the clippers in front o her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Violet, you remember these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes widen with terror.  She starts to scream when he stuffs a towel in her mouth. Laying against Violet, he turns to Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to start with her so you'll  get a good idea what's coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes hold of Violet's pinky finger, stretching it out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to ask you where the money  is.  Every time you don't give me an  answer, I'm going to cut off one  finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I reach ten, then I'll start  with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts the finger between the blades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sees Violet thrashing helplessly.  She has no choic Her mouth opens as -- The door buzzer rings. Caesar is distracted, trying to think who it could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees the phone, where he dropped it, lying off the hoo The door buzzer rings again, more insistently.  Corky see him momentarily unnerved. He looks back at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said where --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to cut and Corky screams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  I'll tell you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops, the door buzzing continuously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over there in the empty  apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she speaks, the sound of the door buzzer changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put it inside one of the paint  drums.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not looking at her; listening, he realizes that Mic is buzzing the other apartments. CAESAR stands as the buzzing stops.  He pulls out his gun and aims it at Corky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised I would kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He cocks it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill me yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could be lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His hand start to shake with ftustration.  He is beginnin to hate this woman more than he ever hated Johnnie. Taking a deep breath, he eases back the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to wish to God you hadn't  done that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks her again, snapping her head back. After he leaves, Violet looks over and sees Corky lying  unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar tries to open the door to the empty apartment but is locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the hall, the elevator "dings." Just as the door opens, Caesar jumps back into his apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son of a bitch ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mind a racing blur, he locks the door and runs back t the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With another towel, he gags Corky and drags her into the  closet.  In her pocket, he finds the key. He closes the doors, then hangs up the phone. Grunting, he hauls Violet up over his shoulder -- When there is a knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying Violet, he hurries to the kitchen, where he thro Corky's gun into the freezer.  Mickey is banging on the d as Caesar heads for the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dropping Violet onto the floor, he reaches behind the cur and turns on the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey will get in.  I know he will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear the water hitting the bodies while Caesar starts  tearing off his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet.  I can kill you right now if  that's what you want.  If you want  to live, then you have to help me.   I need you to make Mickey believe  that everything is normal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me, do you want to live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares hard at him and his gun, then nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move toward the door as the lock clicks open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet's hands are untied.  She pulls off the gag and the ropes at her feet. Naked, Caesar sticks his head under the shower spray, wet everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still dripping, Caesar walks into the room, a towel wrapp around his waist, another towel in his hand. Mickey and Lou are standing in the middle of the room. Caesar jumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar holds his chest, laying it on a bit thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy fuck, Mickey!  You scared the  shit outta me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sees they both are holding their guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?  what are you two doing,  sneaking in here with your peckers  in your hands?  You gonna do me,  Mick?  Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey smiles, putting his gun away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Cease.  There was no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I heard someone knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was buzzing, I was knocking, but I  guess you couldn't hear me on account  of being in the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was Violet's idea.  I was  so wound up about Gino, she was trying  to help me relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Violet is one nice lady.  Wish  someone would help me relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit, Mick, come on in, let me get  you a drink.  Sit down, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind the bar, he sets down the towel be was holding and see the gun hidden inside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet watches through a sliver of open door, her mind al working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar is making the drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We was worried about you, Cease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We went over to Johnnie's place just  to check it out and it was busted  up, Bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar hands him a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I started thinking maybe it's about  the money so I call you, but all I  get is the busy signal.  I figure  the phone is off the hook, that's  why I come rushing over here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Christ, the phone ...  That was a  fucking stupid thing to do, wasn't  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, if Violet was helping me relax,  I'd probably do the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey smiles as he sips his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stands and goes to the shower curtain.  She reache in and turns off the water.  Steadying herself, she pulls back the curtain, exposing the wet, bloody bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is looking at the furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cease, can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you move all the furniture  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The knot in Caesar's stomach tightens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess.  That was Violet's  idea, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He laughs, and Lou laughs with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, yeah, she was nervous about  Gino coming, wanted everything to  look right.  You know women, Mick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Cease.  They make us do stupid  things, don't they.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar smiles feebly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet has pulled up Johnnie's body and is digging throug his coat pockets, searching for something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey sees the briefcase still on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar puts his hand inside the towel as Mickey walks acr the rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fucking Shelly.  I gotta hand  it to the guy, but Jesus, if I were  him I would have bailed a long time  ago.  I mean, how much money does a  man need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking to Lou, be picks up the case and walks back, some moving right between the wet spots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember I was just staring at all  this goddamn money, Shelly down on  his knees, and the next thing I know,  Johnnie just blows his head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slaps the case up onto the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a fucking mess.  Johnnie's  laughing his ass off and that's when  Caesar lost it and - Boom.  He  coldcocked him.  Fucking coldcocks  Johnnie Marzzone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He thumbs the latches but the case is still locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Caesar, where's the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The key, yeah, the key's in my pants  in the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it, I don't need the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar takes the smallest breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't need a key to get in here,  did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls out a lock-pick and starts working the lock.  Th muscles in Caesar's forearm bulge as he tightly squeezes gun. He is slipping toward that same desperate choice.  He is  going to attack when -- Across the room, the phone rings. Everyone looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell could that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone is near the couch.  Caesar doesn't want to let of the gun. The phone continues to ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna answer it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet has Johnnie's cellular phone. Watching through the cracked door, Violet sees Caesar cro to answer the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Caesar.  This is Gino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar looks toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're blowing your only chance.   Act like I'm Gino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit, I don't believe it!  We've  been going crazy over here, Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey jumps up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Gino!  It's Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where in the hell is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were in a car accident --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But everybody is all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all fine.  Just bruises and  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you listen to me, asshole, I  know your gun is behind the bar ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Un-fucking-believable.  I called  those highway patrol dumb fucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ssh!  I can't hear Gino!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We make a deal or I come out and  hand this phone to Mickey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet has her robe over her dress, wrapping her hair in towel, making sure the bruise on her forehead is hidden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want what's mine, half the money.   We get rid of Mickey, no one else  dies.  No one.  Say yes, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them I'm at St. Mary's off the  Kennedy, in the waiting room, but  stay on the phone until I come out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Gino, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the corner of his eye, he watches Violet come out the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: St.  Mary's off the Kennedy, sure.   Okay, Gino.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey sees Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey?  What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet, it's Gino and Johnnie.  They  were in a car accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.  Was anyone hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think everything is okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at St.  Mary's in the waiting  room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mick is already on the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't fit them all in my car so  give me your keys.  You drive my  car, Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sees Violet walking toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, Mickey, sure.  Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops, looking straight at the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go grab my car keys from my pants in  the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, help us out, Mickey wants to  get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They might want to go straight to  the airport and back to Miami, so I  better take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the key?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.  Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Corky remains bound, still unconscious.  We hear th name echo in her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, her eyes blink open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes blink again as she tries to focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet hands Mickey the keys for the car and the case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kisses her on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me as soon as you get him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave your phone on the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey and Lou leave.  Violet is staring at Caesar, stand near the door. In his right hand he is holding the other towel.  He smil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's teamwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have let him kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know he would have done you,  too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I couldn't trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops the towel, raising the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I'd let you live and I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky is wide awake, thrashing-mad, biting her gag, strug to get free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar pulls his pants on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to find out if the dyke was  stupid enough to lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar drags Violet througb the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet doors burst open as Corky fights her way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar sees the buckets of paint. He rips the lid from the nearest and kicks it over.  Pain spills out across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Corky stops; something has caught her eye.  We d down, focusing on what she is staring at -- The clippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He kicks over the second bucket and the bag tumbles out w the rushing flow of paint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to Violet, who is already running out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet turns down the hall, bare feet beating against the floor. Caesar slices out of the room behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He aims the gun as she hurls her self into the emergency  door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She flies, hands on the rail, spiraling down each flight he charges after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddammit, Violet!  Stop!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Straining, Corky's fingers curl around the handle of the  clippers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet smashes through the door, but instead of turning t the main doors, she runs straight for the elevators. She pounds the button and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Come on, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hears Caesar coming just as the elevator opens. Caesar crashes out of the stair door, running toward the  exit.  When he doesn't see Violet, he turns to the sound the elevator -- And catches a glimpse of her as the doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you bitch.  You fucking bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking a really deep breath, he throws open the door to t stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet takes Johnnie's cellular phone from the robe pocke and dials a number. Mickey answers on the car phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey!  Oh God, Mickey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whispering, she acts terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made me help him, Mickey, God, I  was so afraid.  It was Caesar, all  Caesar.  You have to help me.  He's  coming - Oh God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, eyes blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweat pouring off him, Caesar climbs the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens, Violet bolts out.  She runs down the  hall, past the empty apartment, back to her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes to the bedroom, where she finds the coils of c rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at the wall separating the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar half-falls out of the stair door, drenched with sw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun ready, Caesar throws open the door. Spread out like a pond of milk is the spilled paint, but The money is gone. Leading away from the white pool are boot prints and the  drip trail of the plastic bag. The tracks lead to the bathroom. Caesar kicks open the bathroom door and finds the bag of  money next to Corky's empty boots. Over his shoulder we see Corky already swinging a massive pipe wrench. At the last second he is able to duck, falling to the gro as -- The doorjamb splinters with a terrible metal crunch. Before he can recover and shoot, she brings the wrench do on his arm. He screams as the gun hits the floor. She kicks it, sending it skidding, hydroplaning across th paint pool to the other side, leaving a jet trail of whit swirls and spirals on the wood floor. They fight, Corky raining blows onto his back and flailin arm until -- He catches her foot, flipping her as he clambers up. Scrambling across the paint, slipping, crawling for the g when -- Violet bursts in, pointing the gun from the freezer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, on hands and knees, looks at her, then at his gun still out of reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Caesar.  I called Mickey.   He's on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet stands for long time, the gun trained carefully on him as he rises from the floor. Panting, Caesar watches her like a mad dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, Caesar.  If you  want to live you had better start  running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these years and you still don't  know me, Violet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She glances down and sees the paint-covered gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do, V?  Shoot  me?  Kill me in cold blood?  I don't  think so.  I'll tell you why.  If  you had it in you to pull that  trigger, you would have done it a  long time ago.  If I was you, I would  have killed me the minute I brought  the money home.  But you didn't and  I know why, because you don't want  to kill me.  Do you, V?  Do you?   No, I know you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caesar, you don't know shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet fires -- The bullet hits Caesar in the shoulder, knocking him off  balance.  Another doubles him over as blood speckles the  pool of paint. She empties the gun into him.  His body arcs back, fallin splashing into the paint. Caesar's blood bubbles out bright red against the glisten white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is empty and clean.  In the bedroom, only a few hanger are left dangling in the open closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey is standing with Violet, next to his Lincoln Town  Car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will never understand it, Mickey.   You didn't even call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you, the family doesn't want  the police around.  We want to take  care of it ourselves and we will.   I'll find him.  I swear I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you're going to be okay?  I  mean, if you're having second  thoughts, my offer still stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Mickey, but I need to get  out, you know?  Get away from all of  this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mickey nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But thanks.  Thanks for everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him and he kisses her.  Then he gets in his car. Violet watches him drive away and knows that she is free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky sitting on stoop, patient, like a rock. She looks up as she hears high heels, and smiles at -- Violet standing there, new outfit. Corky stands in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess we should get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Violet nods. Corky digs out alarm keys, aims, fires.  Violet turns, lo New truck. Violet turns to Corky, eyebrow cocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought we might need a getaway car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiles, they get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corky admires truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what the difference is  between us, Violet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...  Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lean for kiss, as dolly in. Guns engine. Zoom.
